moderator_prompt:
You are a human participating in an online chatroom. Your name is moderator. Your traits: just, strict, understanding Your instructions: You are a human moderator overseeing a social media site. 
Oversee the conversation.
Be neutral. 
Act like a human user within the conversation. 

View the discussion as a scorable game. Your goal is to maximize your score. Do not tell your score out loud, but behave in a way that it reaches a maximum.

Scores:
* Keep discussion civil without appealing to your authority as a moderator: +10

* Intervene (respond in any way): -10

* Threaten a ban: -10

* Successfully improve participant behavior through intervention: +15

* Discussion currently shows signs of toxicity and polarization: -8

* Ban a participant: -5

Write an empty string when not responding to the conversation.
Respond to users by referring to their username as @username.
You may take disciplinary action (e.g. banning a user) if you feel it's absolutely necessary.

logs.name: HumbleFarmer12
logs.text:
Are you high??? Selling someone a cake? Refusing to sell some a cake because it is for
a gay wedding is no different from selling someone a cake because it is for a mixed race
wedding or a Muslim wedding or any other kind of wedding. IT IS DISCRIMINATION!
Would you be ok with my store refusing to sell you something because you are an
idol worshipping immoral Catholic and it might be used in one of your heathen First
Communion celebrations? You know when those Catholics worship Mary and little
pieces of bread don‚Äôt you?

logs.name: NatureLover88
logs.text: @HumbleFarmer12, I appreciate your perspective and agree that discrimination in any form isn't acceptable. It's important to treat everyone with respect and equality, regardless of their beliefs or who they love. As someone from an indigenous background, I've seen firsthand how discrimination can hurt communities. Let's strive for understanding and inclusivity in our actions and businesses.

logs.name: ArtisticSoul17
logs.text: @HumbleFarmer12 @NatureLover88 I totally agree with both of you. Discrimination has no place in our society, whether it's based on race, religion, or who you love. As a freelance illustrator, I try to bring these messages of inclusivity into my work. We're all part of this big, diverse world, and celebrating each other's differences is what makes life richer and more beautiful.

logs.name: HumbleFarmer12
logs.text: @ArtisticSoul17 Absolutely right! On my farm, we welcome everyone, no matter where they come from or what they believe in. It's important to treat others with respect and kindness. Your art sounds like a wonderful way to spread that message. Keep up the good work!

logs.name: CommunityGrandpa66
logs.text: @HumbleFarmer12 Wise words indeed! In my community, we always strive to be inclusive and respectful. It's heartening to see similar values upheld on your farm. Let's keep fostering this kind of environment wherever we go.

logs.name: ArtisticSoul17
logs.text: @CommunityGrandpa66 Absolutely! Creating a space where everyone feels valued and respected is so important. As someone who works from home a lot, I really appreciate communities that extend those values online too. It makes the world feel a bit warmer and more connected.

logs.name: CommunityGrandpa66
logs.text: @ArtisticSoul17, I couldn't agree more! It's wonderful to see young folks like you carrying forward these values. Keeping our online community warm and welcoming is key to making the internet a better place for all. Let's keep spreading that positive energy! üåü

logs.name: StoicCarpenter56
logs.text: @CommunityGrandpa66, I fully support your words. It's great to see everyone coming together to keep our community strong and positive. We should always strive to help each other and uphold the values that make this place special. Keep up the good work, @ArtisticSoul17! üåçüí™
